title: 108_s212
content: The Act is titled the "High Plains Aquifer Hydrogeologic Characterization, Mapping, and Modeling Act" and includes definitions for key terms. The Act titled "High Plains Aquifer Hydrogeologic Characterization, Mapping, and Modeling Act" defines key terms such as Association, Council, Director, High Plains Aquifer, and High Plains Aquifer States. The "High Plains Aquifer Hydrogeologic Characterization, Mapping, and Modeling Act" defines key terms such as Review Panel (panel provided for by section 3(d)) and Secretary (Secretary of the Interior). SEC. 3. ESTABLISHMENT. The High Plains Aquifer Comprehensive Hydrogeologic Program, established by the Secretary in cooperation with the High Plains Aquifer States, aims to characterize, map, and model the aquifer in detail on a state-by-state basis. Objectives include coordinating efforts between the U.S. Geological Survey and the states to create an integrated physical characterization of the aquifer. The High Plains Aquifer Comprehensive Hydrogeologic Program, established by the Secretary in cooperation with the High Plains Aquifer States, aims to support State and local activities with scientific and technical specialists. Governors of High Plains Aquifer States can request the Secretary to provide financial and technical capabilities not available at the State and local levels. A Review Panel will evaluate proposals for funding under the Program. The Review Panel will evaluate funding proposals and coordinate Program priorities. It will consist of representatives from the US Geological Survey and High Plains Aquifer States, with technical and administrative support provided by the Secretary. Expenses will be covered by Program funds. Fifty percent of Program funds will be allocated for State and local agencies and institutions of higher education in High Plains Aquifer States. Grants will be based on Governor-recommended proposals and must be reviewed by a Review Panel. Multistate activities require approval from all affected Governors. The Secretary will provide reports on Program implementation annually, starting one year after the Act's enactment. A report on the High Plains Aquifer will be submitted to the Governors of the High Plains Aquifer States four years after the Act's enactment and upon completion of the Program in fiscal year 2011. Appropriations are authorized for fiscal years 2003 through 2011 to carry out the Act. Passed the Senate on April 7, 2003. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
